means: 从事( engage的过去式和过去分词)
吸引或引起（注意、兴趣等）

sentence.Network_en: The London City Ballet has engaged two male dancers from the Bolshoi.
sentence.Network_cn: 伦敦市芭蕾舞团从波修瓦芭蕾舞团聘来了两名男舞蹈演员。

sentence.Network_en: I have a large circle of friends and acquaintances engaged in photography.
At least 17 different irregular units are engaged in the war.
sentence.Network_cn: 至少有17个非正规军部队参战。

entry.def: Someone who is engaged in or engaged on a particular activity is doing that thing.

example.ex: They found the three engaged in target practice.
example.tran: 他们发现那3个人在练习打靶。

example.ex: ...the various projects he was engaged on.

entry.def: When two people are engaged, they have agreed to marry each other.

example.ex: We got engaged on my eighteenth birthday...
example.tran: 在我18岁生日那天我们订婚了。

example.ex: He was engaged to Miss Julia Maria Boardman.
example.tran: 他和朱莉娅·玛丽亚·博德曼小姐订婚了。

entry.def: If a telephone or a telephone line is engaged, it is already being used by someone else so that you are unable to speak to the person you are phoning.

example.ex: We tried to call you back but you were engaged.
example.tran: 我们试着给你回电，但是你正在通话中。

entry.tran: （公共厕所）被占用的，使用中的
entry.def: If a public toilet is engaged, it is already being used by someone else.

means.word_mean: 1. having ones attention or mind or energy engaged;

sentences.sentence: "she keeps herself fully occupied with volunteer activities"
"the desperately engaged ships continued the fight"

means.word_mean: 4. (of facilities such as telephones or lavatories) unavailable for use by anyone else or indicating unavailability; (`engaged' is a British term for a busy telephone line);
5. (used of toothed parts or gears) interlocked and interacting;

sentences.sentence: "the carpenter engaged (or employed) for the job is sick"

means.word_mean: 7. built against or attached to a wall;

auth_sentence.content: Chinese officials deny that Beijing engaged in such activities.
auth_sentence.res_content: Chinese officials deny that Beijing engaged in such activities.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Chinese officials deny that Beijing engaged in such activities.

auth_sentence.content: China needs to get more engaged, said Richardson.
auth_sentence.res_content: China needs to get more engaged, said Richardson.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: China needs to get more engaged, said Richardson.

auth_sentence.content: Iraq is now engaged in politics, she said.
auth_sentence.res_content: Iraq is now engaged in politics, she said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Iraq is now engaged in politics, she said.

Sentence.sentence: This is especially true of editors, who by nature tend to be eager and engaged participants in everything they do.
There are three dozen universities in the UK which are actively engaged in advanced research training and commercialisation work
Companies engaged in shipping, trucking, rail freight, delivery, and logistics (物流) have all been reporting better than expected results
